reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Halting the spread of HIV and reversing its impact in Eswatini

description.narrative: Eswatini - TB/HIV - Coordinating Assembly of Non Governmental Organisation - CANGO. This program has the following goals: Halt the spread of HIV and reverse its impact in Swazi society. RSSH: Ensuring adequate health systems to support the attainment of health service targets, especially relating to HIV/AIDS, TB and Malaria. The objectives of this program are: HIV -75% reduction of new HIV infections among AGYW by 2022. 90% reduction of new HIV infections among infants aged 18 - 24 months born to HIV positive mothers by 2015. HIV - Reduce 50% deaths amongst PLHIV and in particular those with TB/HIV co-infection. Increase access to HIV services among key populations( sex workers, MSM) to 90% by 2022. At least 90% of PLHIV know their HIV status by 2022. At least 90% of PLHIV that know their HIV status are initiated on treatment by 2022. At least 90% of patients on ART are virally suppressed by 2022. To scale up and sustain patient level information system in all facilities by 2022. To improve the health products procurement and supply chain management systems, and monitoring of rational use of health products in the country. To build capacity of human resources for health with a focus on supply chain management, community health services and health information systems

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for SWZ-C-CANGO
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women reached with HIV prevention programs- defined package of services
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of young people aged 10–24 years reached by life skills–based HIV education in schools
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of young people aged 10-24 years attending school reached by compehensive sexuality education and/or life skills-based HIV education in schools
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Impact indicator for SWZ-C-CANGO
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB/HIV mortality rate per 100,000 population
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Percentage of people living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Outcome indicator for SWZ-C-CANGO
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of women and men aged 15–49 who report discriminatory attitudes towards people living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of (estimated) people living with HIV who have been tested HIV-positive
